title: Door Lock Problem
fixes: The washing machine door isn't properly closed, or there's a malfunction with the door lock mechanism. Ensure the door is shut firmly and check for any obstructions preventing a complete closure. A faulty door lock switch or electrical issue with the lock could also be the culprit.

title: Drum Motor Control Error
fixes: A problem has been detected with the control board or motor that regulates the drum's rotation. This could be due to a faulty motor, a malfunctioning control board, or an electrical wiring issue.

title: Communication Error Between Control Boards (on specific models)
fixes: In some Electrolux washers with dual control boards, this code signifies a communication error between them. This could be due to a faulty control board or a loose connection between the boards.

title: Insufficient Water During Washing Stage
fixes: The washer isn't detecting enough water during the washing cycle. Recheck for clogged water inlet issues or a faulty water inlet valve.

title: Water Overflow Error
fixes: The washer has detected an excessive amount of water in the drum, potentially due to a malfunctioning pressure sensor or a faulty inlet valve.

title: Electronic circuit board fault
fixes: This code indicates a problem with the main control board of your washing machine. Possible causes include a faulty component on the board, electrical wiring issues, or water damage.

title: Door open error
fixes: The washing machine door isn't properly closed or there's a malfunction with the door lock mechanism. Ensure the door is shut firmly and check for any obstructions preventing a complete closure. A faulty door lock switch or electrical issue with the lock could also be the culprit.

title: Temperature sensing fault
fixes: The NTC thermistor, which is responsible for measuring water temperature, is malfunctioning. This could be due to a faulty sensor itself, a loose connection between the sensor and the control board, or a problem with the control board.

title: Water filling error
fixes: The washer is unable to fill with water properly during the cycle. Potential causes include a clogged water inlet valve or filter screen, kinked or blocked water supply hose, or low water pressure from the house supply.

title: Waste pipe blockage or pump issue
fixes: There's a blockage in the drain hose or a malfunction with the drain pump. Check the drain hose for any objects lodged within and clear any clogs. A faulty drain pump or an electrical issue with the pump could also be the problem.

title: Door lock fault
fixes: Similar to F02, this code indicates an issue with the door lock mechanism. Check for proper closure and any obstructions. A faulty door lock switch or electrical problem could be the culprit.

title: Heater relay stuck
fixes: The relay that controls the heating element is stuck in the on position, causing the water to overheat. This could be due to a faulty relay itself or an issue with the control board.

title: Heater relay stuck (alternative)
fixes: In some Hotpoint models, F08 might also indicate a stuck heater relay, similar to F07.

title: Setup Error
fixes: This code is less common and might signify an error during the initial setup of the washing machine. Consult your user manual for troubleshooting steps specific to your model.

title: Pressure Switch
fixes: The pressure switch, which monitors water levels in the drum, is malfunctioning. This could be due to a faulty pressure switch itself, a blocked pressure hose, or an issue with the control board.

title: Drain pump
fixes: Similar to F05, this code indicates a problem with the drain pump. Check for clogs in the drain hose and ensure the pump is functioning properly.

title: No communication between control boards
fixes: In some Hotpoint models with dual control boards, this code signifies a communication error between them. This could be due to a faulty control board or a loose connection between the boards.

title: Dryer temperature sensing fault (washer dryers only)
fixes: This code is specific to Hotpoint washer dryers and indicates a problem with the temperature sensor for the drying function. The NTC thermistor responsible for monitoring drying temperature might be faulty.

title: Dryer not heating (washer dryers only)
fixes: Another code specific to washer dryers, F14 indicates the dryer function isn't heating properly. This could be due to a malfunctioning heating element, a faulty temperature sensor, or an issue with the control board.

title: Dryer element relay (washer dryers only)
fixes: Yet another code specific to washer dryers, F15 points towards a problem with the relay controlling the heating element in the drying function. This could be a faulty relay itself or an issue with the control board.

title: Not used (alternative)
fixes: In some models, F16 might not be used.

title: Door lock
fixes: Similar to F02 and F06, this code signifies a problem with the door lock mechanism. Ensure proper closure and check for any obstructions. A faulty door lock switch or electrical issue with the lock could be the culprit.

title: Communications Error on 3 phase motor
fixes: This code indicates an error in communication between the control board and a 3-phase motor, which is less common in household washing machines. It suggests a problem with the motor, its connection, or the control board.

title: Door Open Error
fixes: The washing machine door is not properly closed or there's a malfunction with the door lock mechanism. Ensure the door is shut firmly and check for any obstructions preventing a complete closure. A faulty door lock switch or electrical issue with the lock could also be the culprit.

title: Water Filling Error
fixes: The washer is unable to fill with water properly during the cycle. Potential causes include a clogged water inlet valve or filter screen, kinked or blocked water supply hose, or low water pressure from the house supply.

title: Water Heating Error
fixes: The washer is having difficulty heating the water to the desired temperature. This could be due to a faulty heating element, a malfunctioning NTC thermistor (temperature sensor), or an issue with the control board.

title: Drain Error
fixes: The washer is unable to drain the water properly during the cycle. A clogged drain hose, blocked drain pump, or faulty drain pump could be the culprit.

title: Drum Unbalance Error
fixes: The laundry load in the drum is unbalanced, causing excessive vibration. Redistribute the laundry items for a more even weight distribution.

title: Motor Error
fixes: A problem has been detected with the washing machine's motor. This could be due to a faulty motor itself, a malfunctioning motor control board, or an electrical wiring issue.

title: Water Supply Error (alternative for 4E in some models)
fixes: Similar to 4E, this code indicates a problem with water filling. Check the water supply hose for kinks or blockages, ensure the water valve is fully open, and verify sufficient water pressure.

title: Drain Hose Error
fixes: There might be a leak in the drain hose or a problem with the way the hose is positioned. Check for any leaks or damage to the hose and ensure it's properly secured to the drain outlet.

title: Overflow Error
fixes: The washer has detected an excessive amount of water in the drum, potentially due to a malfunctioning pressure sensor or a faulty inlet valve.

title: Overflow Fault (alternative for OE in some models)
fixes: Similar to OE, this code signifies an overflow error.

title: Overcurrent Error
fixes: The washer has detected a surge in electrical current. This could be due to a power surge or a problem with the motor or control board.

title: Excessive Suds Error
fixes: The washer has detected too much soap suds in the water. This could be caused by using too much detergent or using an inappropriate detergent type for your machine.

title: Time Error
fixes: The washing cycle is taking significantly longer than expected. This could be due to a problem with the water supply, drainage, or a malfunctioning sensor.

title: Child Lock Activated
fixes: The child lock function is engaged on the control panel, disabling certain buttons.

title: Sensor Error
fixes: A problem has been detected with one of the washing machine's sensors, such as the NTC thermistor or pressure sensor.

title: Communication Error
fixes: There's an issue with communication between the control board and other components in the washer.

title: Electronic circuit board fault
fixes: This code indicates a problem with the main control board of your washing machine. Possible causes include a faulty component on the board, electrical wiring issues, or water damage.

title: Door not closed properly
fixes: Faulty door lock mechanism, damaged door switch, debris preventing the door from closing fully.

fixes: Faulty door lock mechanism, electrical issue with the door lock.

title: Water supply failure
fixes: Clogged water inlet valve, kinked or blocked water supply hose, issue with the house water supply.

fixes: Low water pressure from the house supply, clogged water inlet valve or filter screen.

fixes: Faulty drain pump, blocked drain hose, object lodged in the drain pump.

fixes: Issue with the motor control board, electrical wiring problem.

fixes: Faulty motor tachometer, problem with the motor control board.

fixes: Faulty control board, loose connection between control boards.

fixes: Faulty heating element, issue with the wiring to the heating element.

fixes: Faulty pressure sensor, clogged drain hose.

title: Water leakage detected (triggered by Aquastop system)
fixes: Leak in the washing machine tub or hoses, faulty Aquastop hose.

title: Motor overheating
fixes: Motor overload due to heavy load, worn motor bearings.

fixes: Software glitch in the control board, power surge.

fixes: Faulty water turbidity sensor, very dirty wash water.

fixes: Faulty pressure sensor, problem with the house water supply.

fixes: Clogged water inlet valve or filter screen, low water pressure from the house supply.

fixes: Faulty water meter, issue with the wiring to the water meter.

fixes: Faulty main inlet valve, electrical issue with the valve.

fixes: Blocked detergent drawer, faulty dispenser mechanism.

fixes: Faulty light control unit, electrical wiring problem.

fixes: The motor is overloaded, likely due to an excessively heavy load. Reduce the amount of laundry in the drum and restart the cycle.

fixes: The washing machine door isn't properly closed, or there's a malfunction with the door lock mechanism. Ensure the door is shut firmly and check for any obstructions preventing a complete closure. A faulty door lock switch or electrical issue with the lock could also be the culprit.

title: Water Inlet Error
fixes: The washer is unable to fill with water properly during the cycle. Potential causes include a clogged water inlet valve or filter screen, kinked or blocked water supply hose, or low water pressure from the house supply.

title: Drain Error
fixes: The washer is unable to drain the water properly during the cycle. A clogged drain hose, blocked drain pump, or faulty drain pump could be the culprit.

title: Water Level Pressure Sensor Fault
fixes: The pressure sensor, which monitors water levels in the drum, is malfunctioning. This could be due to a faulty pressure switch itself, a blocked pressure hose, or an issue with the control board.

title: Water Overflow Error
fixes: The washer has detected an excessive amount of water in the drum, potentially due to a malfunctioning pressure sensor or a faulty inlet valve.

title: Water Heating Error
fixes: The washer is having difficulty heating the water to the desired temperature. This could be due to a faulty heating element, a malfunctioning NTC thermistor (temperature sensor), or an issue with the control board.

title: Unbalanced Load Error
fixes: The laundry load in the drum is unbalanced, causing excessive vibration. Redistribute the laundry items for a more even weight distribution.

title: Current Error
fixes: The washer has detected a surge in electrical current. This could be due to a power surge or a problem with the motor or control board.

title: Motor Overload Error
fixes: The motor is overloaded, likely due to an excessively heavy load. Reduce the amount of laundry in the drum and restart the cycle.

title: Child Lock Activated
fixes: The child lock function is engaged on the control panel, disabling certain buttons.

title: Motor Error or PCB Error
fixes: This code indicates a potential issue with the motor itself or the main control board (PCB). This could be due to a malfunctioning motor, a faulty control board, or an electrical wiring issue.

title: Water Level Sensor Error
fixes: The water level sensor is malfunctioning or has a faulty connection. Check the sensor wiring and connections, or replace the sensor if necessary.

title: Overcurrent Error
fixes: The motor is drawing too much current, indicating a potential motor or control board issue. Unplug the unit and contact a technician for motor inspection.

title: Power Supply Error
fixes: There is an issue with the electrical power supply to the washer. Check the power cord connection and verify proper voltage at the outlet.

title: Communication Error
fixes: The main control board cannot communicate with other components. Reset the washer by unplugging for 5 minutes, or check internal wiring connections.

title: Motor Relay Error
fixes: The motor relay on the control board has failed or stuck. This typically requires replacement of the main control board.

title: Water Temperature Error
fixes: The water temperature is too high, exceeding 122°F (50°C). Check the hot water supply temperature and ensure cold water is also connected.

title: Door Lock Error
fixes: The door is not locking properly or the lock mechanism has failed. Ensure the door is fully closed and check for obstructions in the door latch.

title: Fan Error
fixes: The cooling fan is not operating correctly. Check for obstructions and verify the fan motor is receiving power.

title: Water Leak Error
fixes: A water leak has been detected in the base of the washer. Check all hose connections and inspect the door seal for damage.

title: Stuck Key Error
fixes: A button on the control panel is stuck or continuously pressed. Clean the control panel and check for stuck buttons.

title: Motor Overload
fixes: The motor is overloaded or overheating. Reduce the load size and ensure proper ventilation around the washer.

title: Door Lock Failure
fixes: The door lock mechanism has completely failed. Replace the door lock assembly to restore function.

title: No Drain
fixes: The washer is unable to drain water from the tub. Check the drain pump and hose for blockages.

title: Water Fill Failure
fixes: The washer cannot fill with water. Verify water supply is on and inlet filters are clean.

title: No Water Detected
fixes: The washer is not detecting water entering the tub. Check water supply valves, inlet screens, and the pressure switch.

title: Long Drain
fixes: The drain cycle is taking longer than expected. Clean the drain pump filter and check for restrictions in the drain system.

title: Door Lock Error
fixes: The door will not lock or unlock properly. Inspect the door lock mechanism and wiring for faults.

title: Heater Error
fixes: The water heater is not reaching the target temperature. Test the heating element and replace if defective.

title: Temperature Sensor Error
fixes: The water temperature sensor is reading out of range. Check the thermistor connections and resistance values.

title: Door Switch Error
fixes: The door switch is not detecting the door position correctly. Clean the door switch contacts or replace the switch.

title: Overflow Error
fixes: The pressure switch indicates an overflow condition. Check for a stuck pressure switch or faulty water inlet valve.

title: Serial Communication Failure
fixes: Communication has failed between control boards. Verify all wire harness connections are secure.

title: Door Unlock Error
fixes: The door lock will not release after the cycle. Manually release the lock and check the lock mechanism.

title: Dispenser System Failure
fixes: The detergent dispenser system is not operating. Check the dispenser motor and ensure it's not jammed.

title: MCU Failure
fixes: The motor control unit has experienced a critical failure. Replace the MCU to restore washer operation.

title: Pump Drive System Error
fixes: The drain pump drive system has failed. Check the pump motor and drive mechanism for damage.

title: Pump System Error
fixes: The drain pump is not operating correctly. Test the pump for continuity and check for blockages.

title: Door Open Error
fixes: The door is open or not latching properly. Close the door completely and check for obstructions.

title: Door Switch Error
fixes: The door switch is not detecting the door position. Clean the switch contacts or replace the door switch.

title: Hall Sensor Error
fixes: The motor hall sensor is not detecting rotation. This typically requires motor replacement.

title: Drain Hose Error
fixes: The drain hose is positioned incorrectly or is clogged. Ensure the drain hose is not more than 8 feet high.

title: Heater Sensor Error
fixes: The heating element temperature sensor has failed. Check the sensor wiring and resistance.

title: Vent Sensor Error
fixes: The dryer vent temperature sensor is malfunctioning. Inspect the sensor and its connections.

title: EEPROM Error
fixes: The control board's memory chip has an error. Try resetting the washer or replace the control board.

title: Auto Restart Error
fixes: The washer attempted to auto-restart after a power failure but failed. Manually restart the cycle.

title: Water Leak Error
fixes: A water leak has been detected. Check all hoses and connections for leaks and inspect the door seal.

title: Load Size Error
fixes: The washer cannot determine the load size. Ensure clothes are distributed evenly in the drum.

title: Clutch Error
fixes: The clutch mechanism is not engaging properly. This typically requires professional service.

title: Child Lock Active
fixes: The child lock feature is enabled. Press and hold the child lock button for 3 seconds to disable.

title: Door Lock Active
fixes: The door is locked and cannot be opened. Wait for the cycle to complete or perform a drain cycle.

title: Door Lock Failure
fixes: The door lock mechanism has completely failed. Replace the door lock assembly.

title: Fill Timeout
fixes: The washer did not fill with water in the allotted time. Check water supply valves and inlet hoses for restrictions.

title: Drain Timeout
fixes: The washer did not drain within the expected time. Clean the drain pump filter and check for clogs.

title: Drain Pump Error
fixes: The drain pump is not operating correctly. Check for blockages and test the pump motor for continuity.

title: Drain Hose Error
fixes: The drain hose is kinked or clogged. Straighten the hose and remove any obstructions.

title: Door Lock Error
fixes: The door will not lock properly. Ensure the door is fully closed and check the lock mechanism.

title: Door Lock Failure
fixes: The door lock has failed and needs replacement. Install a new door lock assembly.

title: Pressure Sensor Error
fixes: The water level pressure sensor is malfunctioning. Check the air tube and pressure switch connections.

title: Pressure System Error
fixes: The pressure sensing system has detected an error. Inspect the pressure switch and air dome.

title: Door Open Error
fixes: The door is open or not latching. Close the door firmly and check for obstructions in the latch.

title: Door Switch Error
fixes: The door switch is not functioning properly. Test the switch and replace if necessary.

title: Motor Error
fixes: The motor is not operating correctly or has failed. Check motor connections and test for proper operation.

title: Motor Speed Error
fixes: The motor cannot reach the target speed. Inspect the motor and drive belt for issues.

title: Motor Tachometer Error
fixes: The motor speed sensor is not working. Check the tach connections and replace if faulty.

title: Heater Error
fixes: The water heater is not functioning. Test the heating element for continuity and proper resistance.

title: Heater Timeout
fixes: The water did not reach target temperature in time. Check the heater and thermistor.

title: Temperature Sensor Error
fixes: The temperature sensor is reading out of range. Test the thermistor resistance and replace if needed.

title: NTC Sensor Error
fixes: The NTC temperature sensor has failed. Check sensor connections and resistance values.

title: Overflow Error
fixes: The washer has detected an overflow condition. Check the pressure switch and water inlet valve.

title: Water Level Error
fixes: The water level is not correct for the selected cycle. Inspect the pressure system components.

title: Selector Switch Error
fixes: The cycle selector switch is not functioning. Clean the switch contacts or replace the switch.

title: Communication Error
fixes: The control boards cannot communicate. Check all wire harness connections between boards.

title: Control Board Error
fixes: The main control board has detected an internal error. Reset or replace the control board.

title: Mismatch Error
fixes: There is a mismatch between control board settings. Verify the correct control board is installed.

title: Configuration Error
fixes: The washer configuration is incorrect. Reconfigure the settings or replace the control board.

title: Cycle Error
fixes: An error occurred during the wash cycle. Reset the washer and select a new cycle.

title: Motor Control Error
fixes: The motor control unit is not functioning correctly. This typically requires MCU replacement.

title: Water Fill Error
fixes: No water is entering the washer. Check water supply valves and inlet screens.

title: Drain Pump Error
fixes: The drain pump is not working properly. Clean the pump filter and check for obstructions.

title: Door Lock Failure
fixes: The door lock mechanism has failed. Replace the door lock assembly.

title: Heater Error
fixes: The water heater is not working. Test the heating element and replace if defective.

title: Temperature Sensor Error
fixes: The water temperature sensor is faulty. Check thermistor connections and resistance.

title: Door Switch Error
fixes: The door switch is not detecting properly. Clean or replace the door switch.

title: Overflow Error
fixes: An overflow condition has been detected. Check the pressure switch and water valve.

title: Communication Failure
fixes: Control board communication has failed. Verify all connections are secure.

title: Door Unlock Error
fixes: The door will not unlock. Manually release and check the lock mechanism.

title: Dispenser Failure
fixes: The detergent dispenser system has failed. Check the dispenser motor.

title: MCU Failure
fixes: The motor control unit has failed critically. Replace the MCU.

title: Pump Drive Error
fixes: The drain pump drive system has failed. Check the pump motor and drive.

title: Pump System Error
fixes: The drain pump system is not operating. Test the pump and check for blockages.

title: Analog Pressure Sensor Error
fixes: The analog pressure sensor has failed. Replace the pressure sensor assembly.

title: NTC Sensor Failure
fixes: The temperature sensor has failed in your Viking appliance. Contact Viking authorized service to replace the genuine NTC sensor and recalibrate the system.

title: Door Lock Mechanism Error
fixes: The Viking door lock assembly is not engaging properly. Verify the door alignment and check the electronic lock module for proper voltage.

title: Drain Pump Malfunction
fixes: The Viking drain pump is not operating within specifications. Inspect the pump impeller for debris and test the pump motor resistance.

title: Water Inlet Valve Error
fixes: The water inlet valve is not responding correctly. Check the Viking valve solenoids and ensure proper water pressure (20-120 PSI).

title: Pressure Switch Failure
fixes: The analog pressure sensor has failed. Replace with genuine Viking pressure switch and verify the air tube is clear.

title: Motor Control Error
fixes: The inverter motor control has detected a fault. Check the motor windings and hall sensor connections on your Viking unit.

title: Heating Element Failure
fixes: The heating element circuit is open or shorted. Test the Viking heating element for continuity (should read 10-15 ohms).

title: Communication Error
fixes: The main control board cannot communicate with the user interface. Inspect the ribbon cable connection and reseat the UI board.

title: Overflow Protection
fixes: The overflow protection system has activated. Check the pressure system and ensure the Viking drain pump is functioning properly.

title: Motor Overload
fixes: The motor has exceeded current limits. Reduce load size and verify the Viking motor bearings are not seized.

title: Evaporator Sensor Error
fixes: The evaporator temperature sensor is reading out of range. Replace the Sub-Zero sensor and verify proper refrigerant charge.

title: Condenser Fan Failure
fixes: The condenser fan motor is not operating. Check the fan motor and ensure the Sub-Zero condenser coils are clean.

title: Defrost Heater Error
fixes: The defrost heater circuit has failed. Test the Sub-Zero defrost heater and thermal fuse for continuity.

title: Ice Maker Malfunction
fixes: The ice maker module is not cycling properly. Verify water supply and check the Sub-Zero ice maker motor and heater.

title: Air Damper Error
fixes: The air damper control is not responding. Inspect the damper motor and ensure the Sub-Zero damper moves freely.

title: Compressor Failure
fixes: The compressor is not starting or running inefficiently. Check the start relay and verify proper voltage to the Sub-Zero compressor.

title: Door Ajar Warning
fixes: The door switch indicates the door is not fully closed. Adjust the Sub-Zero door alignment and check the magnetic door seal.

title: Water Filter Alert
fixes: The water filter has reached its service life. Replace with genuine Sub-Zero water filter cartridge.

title: Control Board Error
fixes: The main control board has detected an internal fault. Reset the Sub-Zero unit and if error persists, replace the control board.

title: Temperature Alarm
fixes: The cabinet temperature has exceeded safe limits. Check for airflow obstructions and verify the Sub-Zero sealed system is functioning.

title: Ignition Failure
fixes: The gas ignition system is not lighting the burner. Clean the Wolf igniter and verify proper gas flow to the burner.

title: Oven Temperature Sensor Error
fixes: The oven temperature probe is reading incorrectly. Replace the Wolf RTD sensor and recalibrate the oven.

title: Convection Fan Motor Error
fixes: The convection fan is not operating at correct speed. Check the Wolf fan motor and ensure the fan blade is not obstructed.

title: Door Lock Failure
fixes: The self-clean door lock is not engaging. Inspect the Wolf door lock motor and verify the lock mechanism moves freely.

title: Relay Board Failure
fixes: The relay control board has failed. Replace the Wolf relay board and check for any shorted components.

title: Cooling Fan Error
fixes: The cooling fan is not operating properly. Test the Wolf cooling fan motor and ensure proper ventilation clearances.

title: Keypad Communication Error
fixes: The control panel cannot communicate with the main board. Reseat the Wolf keypad connector and check the ribbon cable.

title: Broil Element Failure
fixes: The broil heating element has failed. Test the Wolf broil element for continuity (should read 15-30 ohms).

title: Bake Element Failure
fixes: The bake heating element is not heating. Check the Wolf bake element and high-limit thermostat.

title: Self-Clean Timeout
fixes: The self-clean cycle did not complete properly. Ensure the Wolf oven door is locked and the temperature sensor is functioning.

title: Temperature Sensor Fault
fixes: The oven temperature sensor is malfunctioning. Replace the Thermador sensor probe and verify resistance at room temperature (1080-1100 ohms).

title: Door Lock Error
fixes: The door lock mechanism is not functioning during self-clean. Check the Thermador door lock motor and switch assembly.

title: Relay Control Failure
fixes: The relay board has detected a fault. Inspect the Thermador relay board for burnt components and replace if necessary.

title: Cooling System Error
fixes: The cooling fan system is not operating correctly. Test the Thermador cooling fan motor and check for proper voltage.

title: Convection System Fault
fixes: The convection fan or element has failed. Check the Thermador convection motor and heating element for continuity.

title: Control Panel Error
fixes: The electronic control panel is not responding. Reset the Thermador oven and check the control board connections.

title: Bake Element Circuit Open
fixes: The bake element circuit is open. Test the Thermador bake element and thermal fuse for continuity.

title: Broil Element Circuit Open
fixes: The broil element has failed. Replace the Thermador broil element and check the wiring harness.

title: Communication Error
fixes: Communication between control boards has failed. Inspect all Thermador wire harness connections and reseat connectors.

title: Self-Clean Error
fixes: The self-clean cycle has encountered an error. Ensure the Thermador door is properly locked and temperature sensor is accurate.

title: NTC Temperature Sensor Error
fixes: The temperature sensor has failed in your Miele appliance. Replace with genuine Miele NTC sensor and verify proper connection.

title: Motor Tacho Error
fixes: The motor speed sensor is not detecting rotation. Check the Miele motor tacho sensor and wiring harness.

title: Drain Pump Blocked
fixes: The drain pump is blocked or not operating. Clean the Miele drain pump filter and check for foreign objects.

title: Water Inlet Fault
fixes: Water is not entering the machine properly. Check the Miele inlet valve and ensure water pressure is 14.5-145 PSI.

title: Door Lock Malfunction
fixes: The door lock is not engaging correctly. Inspect the Miele door lock mechanism and electrical connections.

title: Pressure Sensor Error
fixes: The water level pressure sensor has failed. Replace the Miele pressure sensor and check the air tube.

title: Heating System Fault
fixes: The heating element or relay has failed. Test the Miele heating element and check the relay board.

title: Motor Control Error
fixes: The motor control module has detected a fault. Check the Miele motor and control board connections.

title: Overflow Protection Active
fixes: The overflow protection has been triggered. Check for leaks and verify the Miele pressure switch is functioning.

title: Communication Error
fixes: The control boards cannot communicate. Inspect all Miele wire connections and reseat the control modules.

title: Oven Sensor Failure
fixes: The oven temperature sensor is reading incorrectly. Replace the Dacor sensor probe and verify proper installation.

title: Door Lock Error
fixes: The self-clean door lock is malfunctioning. Check the Dacor door lock assembly and motor.

title: Relay Board Fault
fixes: The relay control board has failed. Inspect the Dacor relay board for damaged components.

title: Cooling Fan Failure
fixes: The cooling fan motor is not operating. Test the Dacor cooling fan and check for obstructions.

title: Convection Error
fixes: The convection system is not functioning. Check the Dacor convection fan motor and element.

title: Control Board Error
fixes: The main control board has detected an error. Reset the Dacor oven and verify all connections.

title: Bake Element Open
fixes: The bake heating element circuit is open. Test the Dacor bake element for continuity.

title: Broil Element Open
fixes: The broil element has failed. Replace the Dacor broil element and check wiring.

title: Keypad Error
fixes: The control panel is not responding correctly. Clean the Dacor keypad and check the membrane switch.

title: Temperature Limit Error
fixes: The oven has exceeded safe temperature limits. Check the Dacor high-limit thermostat and temperature sensor.

title: Motor Speed Error
fixes: The motor is not reaching target speed. Check the Fisher & Paykel motor and drive belt for proper operation.

title: Water Level Error
fixes: The water level sensor is not detecting correctly. Inspect the Fisher & Paykel pressure system and sensor.

title: Drain Timeout
fixes: Water is not draining within the allotted time. Clean the Fisher & Paykel drain pump and check for blockages.

title: Door Lock Fault
fixes: The door lock is not engaging properly. Check the Fisher & Paykel door lock assembly and wiring.

title: Temperature Sensor Error
fixes: The water temperature sensor has failed. Replace the Fisher & Paykel thermistor and verify connections.

title: Overflow Protection
fixes: The overflow sensor has been triggered. Check for leaks and verify the Fisher & Paykel pressure switch.

title: Motor Control Error
fixes: The motor control board has detected a fault. Inspect the Fisher & Paykel motor control module.

title: Heating Element Failure
fixes: The heating element is not functioning. Test the Fisher & Paykel heater for continuity.

title: Communication Error
fixes: The control boards cannot communicate. Check all Fisher & Paykel wire harness connections.

title: Inlet Valve Error
fixes: The water inlet valve is not operating correctly. Test the Fisher & Paykel inlet valve solenoids.

title: Temperature Sensor Malfunction
fixes: The precision temperature sensor has failed. Replace with genuine Gaggenau sensor and recalibrate the system.

title: Door Lock System Error
fixes: The electronic door lock is not functioning. Check the Gaggenau lock mechanism and control module.

title: Heating Element Fault
fixes: The heating element circuit has failed. Test the Gaggenau heating element and thermal protection devices.

title: Cooling System Error
fixes: The cooling fan system is malfunctioning. Inspect the Gaggenau cooling fan motor and temperature sensors.

title: Control Board Failure
fixes: The main control board has detected an internal error. Reset the Gaggenau appliance and check for firmware updates.

title: Convection System Fault
fixes: The convection fan or element is not operating. Check the Gaggenau convection motor and heating element.

title: Communication Error
fixes: The control modules cannot communicate. Inspect all Gaggenau wire connections and control boards.

title: Relay Board Error
fixes: The relay control board has failed. Replace the Gaggenau relay board and check for short circuits.

title: Self-Clean Error
fixes: The pyrolytic self-clean cycle has encountered an error. Verify the Gaggenau door lock and temperature limits.

title: Sensor Calibration Error
fixes: The sensor calibration is out of specification. Perform Gaggenau factory calibration procedure or replace sensors.

title: Water Level Error
fixes: The water level sensor is not detecting properly. Check the Speed Queen pressure switch and air tube for blockages.

title: Drain Timeout
fixes: Water is not draining within the expected time. Clean the Speed Queen drain pump and check for clogs in the drain hose.

title: Motor Overload
fixes: The motor has exceeded current limits. Reduce load size and check the Speed Queen motor for proper operation.

title: Door Lock Error
fixes: The door lock is not engaging. Ensure the door is fully closed and check the Speed Queen lock mechanism.

title: Temperature Sensor Fault
fixes: The water temperature sensor has failed. Replace the Speed Queen thermistor and verify connections.

title: Inlet Valve Error
fixes: The water inlet valve is not operating correctly. Test the Speed Queen inlet valve and check water supply.

title: Drive System Error
fixes: The drive belt or motor has a fault. Inspect the Speed Queen drive belt and motor for wear.

title: Control Board Error
fixes: The main control board has detected an error. Reset the Speed Queen washer and check connections.

title: Overflow Protection
fixes: The overflow sensor has been triggered. Check the Speed Queen pressure system and inlet valve.

title: Unbalanced Load
fixes: The load is severely unbalanced. Redistribute laundry and ensure the Speed Queen washer is level.

title: Control Board Error
fixes: The electronic control board has failed. Replace the Roper control board and verify all connections.

title: Drain Pump Error
fixes: The drain pump is not operating. Clean the Roper drain pump filter and test the pump motor.

title: Temperature Sensor Error
fixes: The water temperature sensor is faulty. Replace the Roper thermistor and check wiring.

title: Door Lock Failure
fixes: The door lock mechanism has failed. Inspect the Roper door lock assembly and replace if necessary.

title: Water Inlet Error
fixes: Water is not entering the washer. Check the Roper inlet valve and water supply.

title: Motor Error
fixes: The motor is not operating correctly. Test the Roper motor and check for proper voltage.

fixes: The water level pressure switch has failed. Replace the Roper pressure switch.

fixes: An overflow condition has been detected. Check the Roper pressure system and inlet valve.

fixes: The control boards cannot communicate. Check all Roper wire connections.

fixes: The motor is not operating correctly. Test the Admiral motor for proper operation.

title: Water Level Sensor Error

title: Motor Error

fixes: Water is not entering the washer. Check the Haier inlet valve and water supply.

title: Limit Circuit Lockout
fixes: ⚠️ SAFETY: Turn off power before inspection. The limit switch has opened 3 times, indicating overheating. Check for blocked air filters, closed supply vents, or a faulty blower motor on your Carrier furnace.

title: Ignition Lockout
fixes: ⚠️ GAS SAFETY: The igniter failed to light the gas after multiple attempts. Verify gas supply is on, check the Carrier igniter for cracks, and ensure proper flame sensor operation.

title: Rollout Switch Open
fixes: ⚠️ DANGER: This indicates flames are escaping the combustion chamber. Immediately turn off the Carrier furnace and call a licensed HVAC technician - this is a serious safety hazard.

title: Pressure Switch Stuck Closed
fixes: The pressure switch is closed when it should be open. Check for a stuck Carrier pressure switch or debris in the pressure tubing.

title: Pressure Switch Stuck Open
fixes: The inducer motor is running but the pressure switch won't close. Inspect the Carrier pressure switch hose for blockages or leaks, and verify proper inducer motor operation.

title: Pressure Switch Open
fixes: The pressure switch failed to close during startup. Check the Carrier inducer motor, pressure switch tubing, and vent system for blockages or restrictions.

title: Limit Switch Open
fixes: ⚠️ OVERHEATING: The high limit switch has opened due to excessive heat. Check your Carrier furnace air filter, ensure all supply registers are open, and verify blower motor operation.

title: Blower Motor Off Delay
fixes: The blower continues running after the heating cycle. This is normal operation on Carrier furnaces to extract residual heat, but if excessive, check the blower control settings.

title: Flame Sense Error
fixes: The flame sensor is not detecting flame properly. Clean the Carrier flame sensor rod with fine steel wool and verify proper grounding of the furnace.

title: Furnace Lockout
fixes: The furnace has locked out after multiple ignition failures. Reset by turning off power for 30 seconds. If problem persists, check gas supply and Carrier ignition components.

title: Low Flame Signal
fixes: Weak flame detection signal. Clean the Carrier flame sensor, check gas pressure (should be 3.5" WC for natural gas), and inspect burner flames for proper blue color.

title: Pressure Switch Stuck Closed
fixes: The pressure switch is closed when the inducer is off. Check the Trane pressure switch for proper operation and inspect for stuck contacts.

title: Pressure Switch Open
fixes: The pressure switch won't close during operation. Verify the Trane inducer motor is running, check pressure tubing for blockages, and inspect the vent system.

title: High Limit Switch Open
fixes: ⚠️ OVERHEATING DETECTED: The furnace is overheating. Check air filter, ensure all vents are open, and verify the Trane blower motor is operating at correct speed.

title: Flame Rollout Switch Open
fixes: ⚠️ CRITICAL SAFETY: Flames are escaping the heat exchanger. Turn off the Trane furnace immediately and contact a professional - this indicates a dangerous condition.

title: Auxiliary Limit Open
fixes: A secondary limit switch has opened. Check for airflow restrictions and verify all Trane safety switches are properly connected.

title: Flame Sense Error
fixes: The flame sensor is not detecting flame. Clean the Trane flame sensor rod with emery cloth and ensure proper furnace grounding.

title: Ignition Lockout
fixes: ⚠️ GAS SAFETY: Multiple ignition attempts have failed. Verify gas supply, check the Trane hot surface igniter for cracks, and test flame sensor operation.

title: Reversed Polarity
fixes: ⚠️ ELECTRICAL HAZARD: The power supply has reversed polarity. Check the Trane furnace electrical connections and verify proper wiring at the breaker panel.

title: Normal Operation
fixes: Continuous LED indicates the Trane furnace is operating normally with no active fault codes.

title: No Power or Control Failure
fixes: ⚠️ POWER ISSUE: No LED indicates loss of power or control board failure. Check the Trane furnace circuit breaker, fuse, and 24V transformer.

title: Normal Heating Operation
fixes: Single blink indicates your Lennox furnace is operating normally in heating mode. No action required.

title: Low Flame Signal
fixes: Weak flame detection. Clean the Lennox flame sensor with fine sandpaper, check gas pressure (3.5" WC natural gas), and inspect burner assembly.

title: Pressure Switch Error
fixes: The pressure switch is not closing properly. Check the Lennox inducer motor operation, inspect pressure tubing for blockages, and verify vent system is clear.

title: Open High Limit Switch
fixes: ⚠️ OVERHEATING: The furnace has exceeded safe temperature limits. Replace air filter, ensure all supply vents are open, and check Lennox blower motor operation.

title: Flame Rollout Switch
fixes: ⚠️ DANGER: Flames detected outside combustion chamber. Shut down the Lennox furnace immediately and call a qualified technician - this is a serious safety issue.

title: Pressure Switch Stuck Closed
fixes: The pressure switch remains closed when it should be open. Test the Lennox pressure switch and check for debris in the sensing tubes.

title: Ignition Lockout
fixes: ⚠️ GAS SAFETY: Three failed ignition attempts. Verify gas valve is open, inspect the Lennox hot surface igniter, and check flame sensor for contamination.

title: Reversed 24V Polarity
fixes: ⚠️ WIRING ERROR: The 24V connections are reversed. Check the Lennox thermostat wiring and control board connections for proper polarity.

title: System Lockout
fixes: The furnace has entered lockout mode after multiple failures. Reset the Lennox furnace by turning off power for 60 seconds, then diagnose the underlying issue.

title: Limit Circuit Lockout
fixes: ⚠️ OVERHEATING: The limit switch has opened multiple times. Check the Goodman furnace air filter, verify blower operation, and ensure adequate airflow.

title: Pressure Switch Stuck Closed
fixes: The pressure switch is closed when the draft inducer is off. Inspect the Goodman pressure switch for stuck contacts or debris.

title: Pressure Switch Open
fixes: The pressure switch won't close during inducer operation. Check the Goodman inducer motor, pressure tubing, and vent system for obstructions.

title: Open High Limit Switch
fixes: ⚠️ HIGH TEMPERATURE: The furnace is overheating. Replace the Goodman air filter, check for closed vents, and verify blower motor speed.

title: Flame Rollout Switch
fixes: ⚠️ CRITICAL: Flames escaping the heat exchanger. Turn off the Goodman furnace immediately - this requires professional inspection.

title: Pressure Switch Failure
fixes: The pressure switch circuit has failed. Test the Goodman pressure switch and check all electrical connections.

title: Low Flame Signal
fixes: Weak or no flame detection. Clean the Goodman flame sensor rod, verify proper grounding, and check gas pressure.

title: Ignition Lockout
fixes: ⚠️ GAS SAFETY: Multiple ignition failures. Verify gas supply to the Goodman furnace, inspect the igniter, and test the flame sensor.

title: Reversed Polarity
fixes: ⚠️ ELECTRICAL: Power connections are reversed. Check the Goodman furnace wiring and verify proper electrical installation.

title: Ignition Lockout
fixes: ⚠️ GAS SAFETY: The ignition system has locked out after failed attempts. Check gas supply to the York furnace, inspect the igniter, and clean the flame sensor.

title: Pressure Switch Stuck Closed
fixes: The pressure switch remains closed when it shouldn't be. Test the York pressure switch and inspect the pressure sensing tubes.

title: Pressure Switch Open Failure
fixes: The pressure switch won't close during operation. Verify the York inducer motor is running and check for vent blockages.

title: High Limit Switch Open
fixes: ⚠️ OVERHEATING: The furnace has exceeded safe temperature. Check the York air filter, ensure proper airflow, and verify blower operation.

title: Flame Rollout Detected
fixes: ⚠️ DANGER: Flames outside the combustion chamber. Shut down the York furnace immediately and call a licensed technician.

title: Auxiliary Limit Open
fixes: A secondary safety limit has opened. Check for airflow restrictions and verify all York safety switches are functioning.

title: Low Flame Signal
fixes: Insufficient flame detection signal. Clean the York flame sensor, check gas pressure, and inspect burner flames.

title: Reversed Polarity
fixes: ⚠️ WIRING ERROR: The electrical polarity is reversed. Check the York furnace electrical connections and correct the wiring.

title: Grounding Issue
fixes: ⚠️ ELECTRICAL SAFETY: Improper grounding detected. Verify the York furnace is properly grounded per electrical codes.

title: No Ignition
fixes: ⚠️ GAS SAFETY: The burner failed to ignite. Check gas supply to the Rheem water heater, verify gas valve is open, and inspect the igniter for proper spark.

title: Flame Failure
fixes: Flame was lost during operation. Check the Rheem flame rod for contamination, verify proper gas pressure (4-10.5" WC), and ensure adequate combustion air.

title: Combustion Fan Error
fixes: The combustion fan is not operating correctly. Inspect the Rheem fan motor, check for obstructions, and verify proper voltage to the fan.

title: Thermal Fuse
fixes: ⚠️ OVERHEATING: The thermal fuse has blown due to excessive heat. Allow the Rheem unit to cool, check for proper ventilation, and replace the thermal fuse.

title: Over Temperature
fixes: ⚠️ SAFETY: Water temperature exceeded 185°F. Check the Rheem temperature sensors, verify flow rate is adequate, and inspect the heat exchanger for scale buildup.

title: Combustion Abnormality
fixes: ⚠️ VENTILATION: Abnormal combustion detected. Check the Rheem vent system for blockages, ensure proper air supply, and inspect burner assembly.

title: Outlet Temperature Sensor
fixes: The outlet thermistor has failed. Test the Rheem outlet temperature sensor resistance (should be ~10kΩ at 77°F) and replace if out of spec.

title: Inlet Temperature Sensor
fixes: The inlet thermistor is malfunctioning. Check the Rheem inlet sensor connections and test resistance values.

title: Solenoid Valve Error
fixes: ⚠️ GAS CONTROL: The gas solenoid valve circuit has failed. Check the Rheem gas valve connections and test the valve coil resistance.

title: Leak Detected
fixes: ⚠️ WATER LEAK: The leak detection system has activated. Inspect all Rheem water connections, check the heat exchanger for leaks, and verify drain pan is dry.

title: Combustion Air Issue
fixes: ⚠️ VENTILATION: Insufficient combustion air detected. Ensure the Rheem air intake is clear, check vent termination, and verify proper installation clearances.

title: Blocked Vent
fixes: ⚠️ DANGER: The vent system is blocked. Immediately check the Rheem vent pipes for obstructions, bird nests, or ice buildup in cold weather.

title: Normal Operation
fixes: Single blink indicates your Bradford White water heater is operating normally. No action required.

title: Temperature Sensor Failure
fixes: The thermistor has failed or is reading out of range. Test the Bradford White temperature sensor resistance and replace if faulty.

title: Pressure Switch Error
fixes: The air pressure switch is not closing properly. Check the Bradford White pressure switch, inspect vent system, and verify proper draft.

title: High Limit Switch
fixes: ⚠️ OVERHEATING: The high limit has opened due to excessive temperature. Allow the Bradford White heater to cool and check for proper water flow.

title: Sensor Fault
fixes: A temperature sensor has failed. Test all Bradford White thermistors and replace any that are out of specification.

title: FVIR Lockout
fixes: ⚠️ FLAMMABLE VAPOR: The Flammable Vapor Ignition Resistant system has locked out. Ensure the Bradford White area is free of flammable vapors and reset the unit.

title: Gas Control Valve
fixes: ⚠️ GAS SAFETY: The gas control valve has failed. Check gas supply to the Bradford White heater and test the valve for proper operation.

title: Low Flame Signal
fixes: Weak flame detection. Clean the Bradford White flame sensor, verify gas pressure, and check burner assembly.

title: Blocked Vent
fixes: ⚠️ VENTILATION: The vent system is blocked or restricted. Inspect the Bradford White vent pipes and ensure proper termination.

title: False Flame
fixes: Flame detected when gas valve is closed. Check the Bradford White flame sensor for contamination or moisture.

title: Normal Standby
fixes: Single blink indicates your AO Smith water heater is in standby mode, ready to heat. This is normal operation.

title: Thermopile Low Voltage
fixes: ⚠️ GAS SAFETY: The thermopile is not generating sufficient voltage. Clean the AO Smith pilot assembly and test thermopile output (should be 325-850mV).

title: Pressure Switch Failure
fixes: The pressure switch is not closing. Check the AO Smith draft inducer, inspect vent system, and test the pressure switch.

title: High Temperature Limit
fixes: ⚠️ OVERHEATING: The ECO (Energy Cut Off) has tripped. Press the reset button on the AO Smith heater after allowing it to cool.

title: Sensor Failure
fixes: A temperature sensor has failed. Test the AO Smith thermistor resistance and replace if readings are incorrect.

title: FVIR Lockout
fixes: ⚠️ FLAMMABLE VAPOR: The system detected flammable vapors. Remove any flammable materials near the AO Smith heater and reset after 10 minutes.

title: Gas Control Valve Failure
fixes: ⚠️ GAS CONTROL: The gas valve has failed. Verify gas supply and test the AO Smith gas valve for proper operation.

title: Thermal Switch Open
fixes: ⚠️ SAFETY: The thermal switch has opened. Check for proper AO Smith combustion and adequate ventilation.

title: Grounding Issue
fixes: ⚠️ ELECTRICAL: Improper grounding detected. Verify the AO Smith water heater is properly grounded per electrical codes.

title: System Lockout
fixes: Multiple failures have caused lockout. Reset the AO Smith heater by turning gas valve to OFF for 10 seconds, then back to ON.

title: Ignition Failure
fixes: ⚠️ GAS SAFETY: The burner failed to ignite after 5 attempts. Check gas supply to the Navien unit, verify gas pressure (4-10.5" WC), and inspect the igniter.

title: Overheat Prevention
fixes: ⚠️ OVERHEATING: Water temperature exceeded 203°F. Check the Navien flow rate, descale the heat exchanger if needed, and verify temperature sensors.

title: Combustion Fan Error
fixes: The combustion fan RPM is abnormal. Inspect the Navien fan motor, check for obstructions, and verify proper voltage supply.

title: Flame Loss
fixes: Flame was lost during operation. Check the Navien flame rod for contamination, verify gas pressure stability, and ensure proper grounding.

title: Over Temperature
fixes: ⚠️ SAFETY: Outlet temperature exceeded 185°F. Verify adequate water flow through the Navien unit and check for scale buildup in the heat exchanger.

title: Exhaust Overheat
fixes: ⚠️ VENTILATION: Exhaust temperature is too high. Check the Navien vent system for blockages and ensure proper vent pipe installation.

title: Igniter Circuit Error
fixes: ⚠️ ELECTRICAL: The igniter circuit has failed. Test the Navien igniter for proper resistance and check control board connections.

title: Combustion Air Pressure
fixes: ⚠️ VENTILATION: Abnormal combustion air pressure detected. Inspect the Navien air intake and vent termination for blockages.

title: Flow Sensor Error
fixes: The water flow sensor is malfunctioning. Clean the Navien flow sensor, check for debris, and verify proper installation.

title: Inlet Temperature Sensor
fixes: The inlet thermistor has failed. Test the Navien inlet sensor resistance (10kΩ at 77°F) and replace if out of specification.

title: Outlet Temperature Sensor
fixes: The outlet thermistor is malfunctioning. Check the Navien outlet sensor connections and test resistance values.

title: Gas Valve Error
fixes: ⚠️ GAS CONTROL: The gas valve circuit has failed. Check the Navien gas valve connections and test valve coil resistance.
